metadata.rationale: Extracted from canonical script and scene co-occurrence data.

data.description: Kensington is a gorgeous 30-something Amazonian bartender who is also a part owner of the bar. She is dressed in a sports halter top and tight skirt, exuding confidence and authority. Her co-ownership of the establishment is evident in her assured, no-nonsense demeanor. She is skilled — demonstrated by her expert sabering of a champagne bottle — and is comfortable giving as good as she gets, particularly with the boisterous Joaquin.
data.dialogue_summary: Kensington has two brief but characterful lines. She tells Joaquin 'Fuck you' when he orders her to turn up the TVs, establishing her as someone who gives back as good as she gets. She also quips 'Startin' out slow, are we?' when delivering Joaquin's large round of shots, demonstrating dry wit. Her dialogue is sparse but punchy, reinforcing her role as a confident, sassy presence in the bar environment.

explicit_evidence.quote: She grabs the bottle and sabers it. Perfectly. She pours up the flutes and keeps walking.
explicit_evidence.source_scene: INT. PRIVATE VIP ROOM - GIANT BOOTH - 5PM

explicit_evidence.quote: She is part owner of this bar, and it shows in her actions.
explicit_evidence.source_scene: INT. PRIVATE VIP ROOM - GIANT BOOTH - 5PM
explicit_evidence.trait: Part owner of the bar — commands respect

explicit_evidence.trait: Enjoys Joaquin's humor while holding her own

inferred_traits.rationale: She effortlessly sabers a champagne bottle that multiple male brokers failed to open, and she manages the bar operations smoothly throughout the scene, including pouring shots, managing trays, and controlling the music and TVs on request.
As a part owner of the bar, she moves through the space with authority. She does not hesitate to tell Joaquin — a loud, dominant personality — to 'fuck you' without any apparent anxiety.
She tolerates Joaquin's crude nicknames (Blanche, Chewie) and his boisterous demands with humor rather than genuine offense, suggesting a thick skin and an enjoyment of the lively environment.
She proactively turns on TV subtitles when the music is turned up, suggesting she is observant and considerate of the needs of those around her without being asked.

data.name: KENSINGTON

relationships.evidence: Kensington and Joaquin have an established rapport built on mutual humor and sass. She tells him 'Fuck you' and he calls her 'Blanche' and 'Chewie'; the script notes she loves his humor and loves to sass him back.
relationships.relationship_type: Friendly antagonistic banter / regular patron and bar owner

relationships.evidence: Cassandra addresses her by the nickname 'Kensy' and gives her direct instructions ('Turn that shit down, and the music UP!'), suggesting familiarity and a working relationship.
relationships.relationship_type: Professional — bar owner and client/employer figure

relationships.evidence: Dante watches Kensington saber the bottle and fill shots; Kensington's actions serve as a backdrop to Dante's introduction to the firm's culture.
relationships.relationship_type: Incidental — observed by Dante as a competent, impressive figure
